Experience Software Systems Architect Intel Corporation April 2014  – Present (1 year 5 months) Greater San Diego Area Director - Software Platforms, R&D Huawei Technologies August 2012  –  April 2014  (1 year 9 months) Greater San Diego Area I am responsible for the U.S. Software Innovation and Design teams for mobile devices and U.S. market product support teams in San Diego and Seattle. I also work with product planning and product 3rd party technology companies to develop new technologies, new business ventures, and products. Global Product Integration Manager Motorola Mobility January 2009  –  August 2012  (3 years 8 months) Direct product engineering teams located throughout the US, Brazil, and China. Plan and orchestrate product development, from initial concept through commercialization. Communicate program status and risks to senior leadership team; monitor internal testing results, certifications, customer lab approval cycles, and post launch return analysis metrics. Interface with product management group to define new product concepts and requirements; relay technical requirements of product roadmaps to clients located in US, Europe, and Asia. Maintain long-term relationships with vendors; negotiate cost-effective agreements. Manage ODM partners in development and manufacture of outsourced smart phone products.  
•	Integral in launching several major products globally, including Motorola’s first Android Touch Tablet Smartphone and world’s thinnest Motorola Droid Razr Smartphone.  
•	Formulated and implemented new test automation solution into product development lifecycle, which substantially improved quality, enhanced efficiency, and cut costs. 
•	Managed cross-functional team comprised of product management, marketing, engineering, customer experience professionals, and selected mobile users to improve the customer experience, user interface, and usability of Motorola smart devices.  
•	Built a highly cohesive team environment; collaborative culture based on innovation generated the top number of disclosures corporate-wide. 
•	Consistently delivered all products within established time and budget timelines, while effectively maintaining quality standards. Distinguished Member of Technical Staff Motorola May 2005  –  June 2009  (4 years 2 months) Championed build of global software platform organization base in US, China, and India. Established and maintained collaborative relationships with carrier contacts; teamed with third-party vendors to determine requirements, establish deliverables, and facilitate resolution of customer-impacting issues. Served as primary point of contact for all CDMA software issues; troubleshot technical issues, identified areas for improvement, and implemented resolutions, ensuring optimal functionality. Supervised team of 80 globally dispersed engineers.  
•	Lead team in developing a software platform that enabled seamless mobility, high speed data, telephony, messaging, audio, device management, and multimedia features, thereby improving product cycle time, quality, and efficiency.  
•	Created software architecture for initial Dual Mode CDMA-iDEN family of feature mobile phones for Sprint-Nextel. 
•	Instrumental in deploying software development process that improved front-end requirements gathering / analysis, enhanced architecture and component designs, reduced implementation times, and shortened back-end integration activities, enabling predictable software deliverables within aggressive time and budget constraints. 
•	Realized significant savings by negotiating cost-effective agreements with third-party software vendors. 
•	Developed software architecture to support multiple modems enabling VoIP over IMS in-call handoffs between CDMA and WiFi. 
•	Spearheaded development and deployment of CDMA Common Software Platform strategy that allowed CDMA organization to create / deliver multiple products to various CDMA carriers with one baseline (Red Razr, Krazr, SLVR, Razr2, W385, 4 Dual Mode CDMA/iDEN products) and 2 CDMA/WiFi technology trials for Qwest and Verizon. Integration Manager Nokia 1997  –  2005  (8 years) Managed end-to-end solution of all IS2000 features through to Release D. Participated in formulating 3GPP2 standards; submitted standard contributions and represented strategic interests within the signaling working group 2.3. Coordinated interoperability tests for prototypes with infrastructure vendors. Defined and documented requirements for R&D software tools. Debugged and tracked software issues.  
•	Created comprehensive project plan to track all phases of software, including development, integration, internal testing, and interoperability testing. 
•	Collaborated with base station infrastructure vendors to exchange roadmap data, thereby enhancing predictability of features to support handsets; demonstrated IS2000 release D capabilities. 
 
Patents:
